description: {"blocks":[{"key":"a94ep","text":"This protocol describes the steps to prepare liquid culture medium for Saccharomyces cerevisiae. This liquid medium is used to optimize yeast cultures for fluorescence imaging by the reduction of auto-fluorescence through an abundance of Adenine [1].","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1151f","text":"The surplus of Methionine in the medium represses the pp7-CP expression, which reduces the level of CP aggregates [2].","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Preparation of 500ml liquid pre-imaging growth medium for Methionine promoted Labeling Systems

cases.title: Medium preparation with pre-resolved components
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5db8k","text":"This version of the protocol shows the preparation of the medium from SC-XX 10x and YNB 20x solutions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

cases.title: Medium preparation from powders
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4cfl","text":"Medium preparation from powders In this version of the protocol the medium is prepared by weighting the SC and YNB powders and resolving them in the medium flask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
